 | average_speed = top_speed = map = map_state = collapsed
}} The 'SociÃ©tÃ© de transport de MontrÃ©al (STM)' () is a public transport agency
that operates transit bus, and rapid transit services in Montreal, Quebec,
Canada. Established in 1861 as Montreal City Passenger Railway Company, it has
grown to comprise four metro lines with a total of 68 stations, as well as over
186 bus routes and 23 night routes.

The STM operates the fourth most heavily used urban mass transit system in North
America, after the New York City Transit Authority, Toronto Transit Commission
and the Mexico City Metro. As of 2011, the average daily
ridership is 2,524,500 passengers: 1,403,700 by bus, 1,111,700 by rapid transit
and 9,200 by paratransit service.

The SociÃ©tÃ© de transport de MontrÃ©al (STM) was created in 2002 to replace the
SociÃ©tÃ© de Transport de la CommunautÃ© Urbaine De MontrÃ©al (STCUM).
